reviews.text: Staff at main lobby was unpleasant til they noticed we were club customers then immediately started to smile and get friendly. We were taken upstairs to club lounge for check in, there was no welcome drinks or anything. Staff did not explain the benefits of club privileges or where everything was. This is poor service for club rooms as you pay premium rate. The room it self was nothing exciting just extra corner for the writing desk. The bathroom was shocking and disgusting, it looks like its in middle of renovation. Tiles were falling of the bath tub. We then discovered the room did not have any bath towels or bath robes. Notify club manager and he was very apologetic and seem extremely embarrassed and offered free drinks to compensate. reviews.text: Whilst the location is reasonably central, this is not the best-situated 4* hotel in Singapore. It's situated on a busy street (Havelock Rd) with the nearest shopping mall (Great World City) 2 large blocks away. This does not sound like much, but you'll still want a (cheap) taxi in wet/humid conditions, in which case you might as well cab it to the Orchard Road shops. It's a reasonably new hotel (9-10 years old) so standard rooms are small, and views not spectacular unless you're on the highest floors. Ask for larger rooms which have a brighter feel (e.g those ending in 04). The hotel backs onto the Singapore river, a very narrow but pleasantly landscaped channel with walkways but again, there's nothing noteworthy within walking distance. The surrounding buildings are mostly hotels of lower (3*) standard with some construction work on one side of the hotel (condominiums rising everywhere); late at night the area just outside the hotel entrance is infested with teens hanging out near the extremely popular 'Zouk' disco, so access to the hotel is by room key in the small hours of the morning; Restaurants are ok (Pontini is one of the better Italian restaurants); the conference floor on level 4 is always buzzing with exhibitors; Coffee shop / pastry counter in lobby; Breakfast buffet has a good selection; Maserati showroom just next door add some panache. More on the rooms: comments: standard rooms are not large; beds good; aircon works (3 fan settings & thermostat); bathroom has all the basics but again quite cramped for a 4* hotel; cleaners do an acceptable job, but could have more attention to detail. I found myself using a bathmat to seal off the rather large gap underneath the door, to stop draughts and to shut out noise (piped music in corridors is audible inside the room at night and can be a little irritating). If you are after a 4* hotel and this is going to be your only stay in Singapore, you should definitely choose a more central location within walking distance of the main attractions. However this hotel is -accordingly- reasonably priced.
reviews.title: not in a prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Singapore for the first time this year on our way back from Australia.Friends had recommended hotels on Orchard Road, but I am glad I ignored them as the situation of this hotel is far nicer - you are a $4 taxi ride from Orchard Road and to be out of the bustle and noise of the shopping centre  was worth every penny.Our room itself, although the furnishings were looking a little tired, was acceptable - the facilites were good and the view of the city from the 21st floor wonderful.There is a lot of building work going on around this hotel, but it didn't spoil our stay - in fact you would be hard pressed to find a hotel in  Singapore where there is no building work nearby,The breakfast in the hotel, although pricey is worth every penny and you can fill up for the whole day on the vast variety of food on offer.The Piano Bar is good for snacks - they serve until late at night.We didn't dine in the other restaurants at the hotel as we wanted to explore the city, but no doubt they were probably of the same high standard.The pool situated on the 6th floor is small but quiet as this hotel is used quite a lot by business people not interested in swimming ! However, you are aware of building noise here - though you do tend to not notice it after a while.However, the real stars of this hotel are the staff - nothing was too much trouble - every member of staff was helpful and friendly. I can't single out any one person as the quality of service was outstanding throughout.As an extra bit of information, a tour company runs tours from the lobby of the hotel, so you are able to book without any hassle and the tours are reasonably priced.I would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to anyone who wants quality service, and  an oasis of calm in bustling Singapore.
reviews.title: If you want quality service - stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well this hotel was picked from reviews that I had seen on trip advisor. No complaints about the condition of the hotel or the very helpful and attentive staff who made us feel a valued customer. Room we had was on the top floor no smoking room and was set away from any other room on the 30th floor. Fantastic views of the city and the river. Main problem that for a 5 star hotel you only qualify for 2 hours free internet access a day (one hour per person). That aside the hotel pool was ok but the breakfast was a little bit cold for cooked items that have been standing for a while and there was no opportunity to get a freshly cooked egg if you wanted it. That said there was a very good selection for every taste and plenty available. Best way into the city was the river taxi. See the concierge for times or there is a free shuttle bus to Orchard road shopping every hour.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: In a place like Singapore where it feels like there are more hotels than homes you could be forgiven for believing that every hotel needs to be at the top of its' game in order to keep customers returning. Copthorne Waterfront (one of three Copthorne hotels on the small business island) Is a very pleseant hotel with good ammunities, location and staff. Breakfast by the river is a great weay to start your day and the staff are always eager but never pushy. There are more than adequate ways to pamper yourself with a nice sized swimming pool, spa service and numerous restaraunts however the rooms didn't have the feel of a 5 star hotel. There were no tea making facilities (even on the executive floors) and the furniture probably hadn't been retouched since the 1980's. Saying that the bedding was a soft a mid summers breeze anabling me to have a great night's sleep even after a frustrating day looking around the Singapore Expo. Food was also a suprising low point of the hotel. We had our breakfast included but after 5 days it became a little uninteresting. The breakfast was exactly the same everyday. The eggs were the same, as were sausages which only had one selection and even the bakery and Chinese food which you can usually find rotate on a daily basis even in 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Good overall but still lacking
